revised_title: The Alcoholic Fermentation of Yeast Juice: Part IV - Fermentation of Glucose, Mannose, and Fructose
tldr: The authors studied the fermentation of glucose, mannose, and fructose by yeast juice and found that fructose is fermented slightly faster than glucose and mannose. They also discovered that the addition of phosphate to the yeast juice affects the fermentation rate, with an optimal concentration for maximum fermentation. The authors also observed that fructose can induce rapid fermentation in glucose or mannose when a large excess of phosphate is present.
